level.heading: PHYSICAL THERAPY ASSISTANTS AND AIDES (ยง 17-6712)

level.text: 6712.1 A physical therapy assistant or physical therapy aide may perform physical therapy functions only in accordance with this section.
6712.2 A physical therapy assistant may perform the following functions under the direct supervision of a physical therapist:
Use of therapeutic exercise, mechanical traction, therapeutic massage, compression, heat, cold, ultraviolet, water, and electricity;
Measurement and adjustment of crutches, canes, walkers, and wheelchairs, and instruction in their use and care;

Instruction, motivation, and assistance to patients and others in improving pulmonary function, learning, and functional activities such asre-ambulation, transfer, ambulation and daily living activities; and the usend care of orthoses, prostheses, and supportive devices;
Modification of treatment procedures as indicated by patient response and withinhe limits specified in the plan of care, and reported orally or in writing tohe physical therapist; and
Participation in routine administrative procedures required for a physical therapy service.
6712.3 A physical therapy aide may perform the following functions under the direct supervision of a physical therapist:
Gait practice;
Activities of daily living;
Transfer activities;
Hot or cold packs;
Paraffin bath;
Hydrotherapy;
Whirlpool; and
Therapeutic exercises.
6712.4 A physical therapy assistant or physical therapy aide may not performhe
following:
Interpret referrals;
Perform evaluation procedures;
Initiate or adjust treatment programs; or
Assume responsibility for planning patient care.
Pursuant to ยง 6710.12, a physical therapist shall review and co-sign any
documentation written by a physical therapy assistant or physical therapy aide.
